@nrk/core-components

Getting started

core-components does not style any elements. It is purely a layer of functionality around some basic components, making sure accessibility and extensibility is easy.

Use from NPM

- recommended 
npm install @nrk/core-components --save
import components from '@nrk/core-components'    // all JS comonents...
import {input} from '@nrk/core-components'       // ...or individual JS component (recommended)
import {Input} from '@nrk/core-components'       // ...or individual JSX component (recommended)

Use with Require.js

 
<link rel="stylesheet" src="https://static.nrk.no/core-components/X.X.X/core-components.min.css"> <!-- Optional styling -->
<script>
require(['https://static.nrk.no/core-components/X.X.X/core-components.min.js'], function(components) { // all...
  /* use components.input etc. here */
});
</script>

Use with script tag

- good for prototyping, avoid in production 
<link rel="stylesheet" src="https://static.nrk.no/core-components/X.X.X/core-components.min.css"> <!-- Optional styling -->
<script src="https://static.nrk.no/core-components/X.X.X/core-components.min.js"></script>
<script>
  /* use window.coreComponents.input etc. here */
</script>

Details release candidate

<details> is a native HTML element for expanding / collapsing content. Our component normalizes styling and polyfills lacking accessibility and browser support. Since polyfilling the DOM property HTMLDetailsElement.open may conflict with other DOM APIs, use instead detailsElement.hasAttribute('open') to check if a <details> element is open.

Demo + usage


Use with JS/HTML

Since this is an HTML-element, there is no JS methods to call. Simply load core-components or core-components/details, make sure only HTML-elements are direct children of <details>, and add role, tabindex and aria-expanded to <summary>: 

<!-- Example: closed -->
<details>
  <summary role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">Closed details</summary>
  <p>Innhold</p>
<details>

<!-- Example: open -->
<details open>
  <summary role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="true">Open details</summary>
  <p>Innhold</p>
<details>

Events

document.addEventListener('toggle', function (event) {}, true) // true = use capture since toggle event does not bubble

Styling

Since styling the marker (traingle) of <details> 

summary[aria-expanded="false"]::before { /* Style closed details marker */ }
summary[aria-expanded="true"]::before { /* Style open details marker */ }

FAQ

Why can I not just use plain progress elements?

UU. That's why.

Why not use web components?

They are not mature for production usage yet.

Her er det kanskje litt mer innhold som beskriver et eller annet valg du må ta.
